definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :1Ki 7:45 (cf. Albrecht:ZAW xvi (1896), 108; f.1Ch 18:8) copper, bronze (NH = BH; Ph. [[נחשת]]; Palm. [[נחשא]] Lzb:322; Syr. nh.o4o0, Targum [[נְחָשָׁא]], Ar. nuh.a0sun, Eth. n4hs: (so also OEth. DHM:Epigr. Denkm. aus Abess. (1894), 52); WMM:As. u. Eur. 127 cites Egypt. teḥ(ḥ)ost, copper (= *tenḥost), as loan-wd. fr. [[נְחשֶׁת]] + fem. art.);—´[[נ]] abs. Ge 4:22 +; cstr. Ex 38:29; sf. [[נְחֻשְׁתִּי]] La 3:7, [[נְחֻשְׁתֵח]] Ez Eze 16:36, [[נְחֻשְׁתָּהּ]] Eze 24:11, [[נְחֻשְׁתָּם]] 2Ki 25:13 + 2 t.; du. [[נְחֻשְׁתַּ֫יִם]] Ju Jdg 16:21 + 6 t.;—

copper, as ore De 8:9, cf. Zec 6:8; worked by artificer Ge 4:22 (J) 1Ki 7:14, 1Ki 7:14, 2Ch 24:12; material—doubtless hardened with alloy, prob. tin, making bronze, cf. Now:Arch. i. 243 Benz:Arch. 214—of armour 1Sa 17:5, 1Sa 17:6, 1Ki 14:27, utensils 2Ki 25:14 = Je 52:18, Le 6:21, Nu 17:4 + very oft., altar 2Ki 16:14, 2Ki 16:15, Ex 38:30, Ex 39:39, etc., and other objects Nu Nu 21:9, Nu 21:9 (JE), 2Ki 18:4, 1Ki 4:13, 1Ki 7:15 ff. +, esp. in description of tabernacle and temple; cast 1Ki 7:14; polished [[מְמׂרָט]] v:1Ki 7:45, [[מָרוּק]] 2Ch 4:16 (cf. Le 6:21); and shining [[מֻחְהָב]] Ezr 8:27. On [[קָלָל]] ´[[נ]] Ez Eze 1:7, Da 10:6 v. [[קלל]]; ´[[נ]] as spoil of war 2Sa 8:8, 2Ki 25:13 = Je 52:17, Je 52:20 etc. †
fetters of copper or  bronze, usu. du. Ju Jdg 16:21, 2Sa 3:34, 2Ki 25:7 = Je 39:7, Je 52:11, 2Ch 36:6, also 2Ch 33:11; sg. only La 3:7 (fig. of oppression).

as less in value than gold but more than wood Is 60:17, Is 60:17; fig. of worthless people Je 6:28 (+ [[בַּרְזֶל]]), id. (as dross of silver) Ez Eze 22:18 (+ [[בְּדִיל]], [[בַּרְזֶל]], [[עוֹפֶרֶת ]]).—On Ez Eze 16:36 v. IV. [[נחשׁ]].
